unnormalised: New Delhi, Oct 26, 2023 – The Indian sporting scene is facing a barrage of injury setbacks, impacting various disciplines just ahead of crucial tournaments and qualifying rounds. Here’s a roundup of the latest injury updates affecting key athletes:
normalised: New Delhi, october twenty sixth, two thousand and twenty three – The Indian sporting scene is facing a barrage of injury setbacks, impacting various disciplines just ahead of crucial tournaments and qualifying rounds. Here’s a roundup of the latest injury updates affecting key athletes:

unnormalised: Cricket: Star batsman, Virat Kohli, suffered a minor back spasm during practice on Oct 24th, raising concerns ahead of the upcoming ODI series against Australia. While the BCCI medical team has confirmed it’s not a serious injury, his participation in the first match remains doubtful. "We are taking it day by day. He is under observation," stated a team spokesperson. Meanwhile, Jasprit Bumrah continues his rehabilitation at the National Cricket Academy (NCA) in Bengaluru following his stress fracture, with an expected return date slated for early December. Sources close to the NCA suggest his recovery is progressing well, but a cautious approach is being adopted to avoid any recurrence.

While the B C C I medical team has confirmed it’s not a serious injury, his participation in the first match remains doubtful. "We are taking it day by day. He is under observation," stated a team spokesperson. Meanwhile, Jasprit Bumrah continues his rehabilitation at the National Cricket Academy (N C A) in Bengaluru following his stress fracture, with an expected return date slated for early December. Sources close to the N C A suggest his recovery is progressing well, but a cautious approach is being adopted to avoid any recurrence.

unnormalised: Badminton: PV Sindhu is still recovering from the knee injury sustained during the Commonwealth Games earlier this year. While she has resumed light training, a full return to competitive badminton is not expected until the All England Open in March 2024. Her coach, Pullela Gopichand, emphasized the importance of allowing ample time for recovery to ensure she returns to her peak form. “Rushing her back would be detrimental in the long run,” he commented.

unnormalised: Football: Sunil Chhetri, the Indian football captain, sustained a hamstring injury during the ISL match against Mumbai City FC on Oct 21st. Preliminary reports suggest he could be out for at least 4 weeks, a major blow to the national team's preparations for the World Cup Qualifiers in November. The Bengaluru FC medical staff are working diligently to expedite his recovery.

unnormalised: Hockey: The Indian Men’s Hockey team is dealing with a shoulder injury to midfielder Hardik Singh. He sustained the injury during a training session at the Major Dhyan Chand National Stadium. The extent of the injury is still being assessed, but initial assessments indicate he might be sidelined for 2-3 weeks.

unnormalised: Athletics: Neeraj Chopra, fresh off his World Championship gold, is managing a persistent elbow issue. He opted out of the Asian Games to focus on rehabilitation and preventative measures. While not a major injury requiring surgery, the javelin star is prioritizing long-term fitness, echoing a sentiment similar to the famous dialogue from the Bollywood film "Chak De! India" - "70 minute hai tumhare paas". This signifies the athletes limited time and need to optimize it well. He aims to compete at his best at the Paris Olympics. Sources indicate he's undergoing specialized physiotherapy and strength training in Pune to address the issue. He is expected to throw in the coming months for shorter distances of around 70-75 km to assess comfort.
